html: After the trial of their faith, Jehovah’s holy ones rejoice at the presence of Jehovah, Israel’s Holy One, when he dwells with them in Zion. For those who repent of transgression, who return to Zion in an exodus out of a world self-destructing, sorrow turns to joy: “Let the ransomed of Jehovah return! Let them come singing to Zion, their heads crowned with everlasting joy; let them obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing flee away” (Isaiah 51:11). Indeed, joy and rejoicing most characterize Jehovah’s millennial reign (Isaiah 9:3; 29:19; 30:29; 51:3; 60:15; 61:7, 10; 65:13, 18-19; 66:10-14).
